test/SillyLockService.h

00001 #ifndef SillyLockService_H
00002 #define SillyLockService_H 1
00003 
00004 /*
00005   This class exists to only allow because ROOT is not thread-safe in its
00006   serialization/deserialization process at the moment.  It will hopefully
00007   be so very soon.  Here we have serialized access to some resource
00008   i.e. the one locking the mutex, where modules (using the module labels
00009   to identify them) are prevented from accessing that resource while running.
00010 
00011   There is only one mutex for the entire system.  We count one service
00012   object being constructed per thread that an event processor runs in.
00013   The current system only makes one event processor in one thread.
00014   If more than one event processor in more than one thread in the future,
00015   then I need to ensure that the service registry is not shared between
00016   any two threads running event processors.
00017  */
00018 
00019 #include "FWCore/ParameterSet/interface/ParameterSet.h"
00020 #include "FWCore/ServiceRegistry/interface/ActivityRegistry.h"
00021 #include "DataFormats/Provenance/interface/EventID.h"
00022 #include "DataFormats/Provenance/interface/Timestamp.h"
00023 #include "DataFormats/Provenance/interface/ModuleDescription.h"
00024 
00025 #include <string>
00026 #include <vector>
00027 #include "boost/thread/mutex.hpp"
00028 
00029 namespace Nuts {
00030   
00031   class SillyLockService
00032   {
00033   public:
00034     SillyLockService(const edm::ParameterSet&,edm::ActivityRegistry&);
00035     ~SillyLockService();
00036 
00037     boost::mutex& getLock() { return *lock_; }
00038     
00039     void postBeginJob();
00040     void postEndJob();
00041       
00042     void preEventProcessing(const edm::EventID&, const edm::Timestamp&);
00043     void postEventProcessing(const edm::Event&, const edm::EventSetup&);
00044       
00045     void preModule(const edm::ModuleDescription&);
00046     void postModule(const edm::ModuleDescription&);
00047 
00048   private:
00049     boost::mutex* lock_;
00050     boost::mutex::scoped_lock* locker_; // what a hack!
00051     typedef std::vector<std::string> Labels;
00052     Labels labels_;
00053   };
00054 }
00055 
00056 #endif
